meanings.definition: A wind blowing directly against the course of a moving object, especially an aircraft or ship.
meanings.sent1: The airplane struggled to move forward due to the strong headwind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors faced a challenging headwind as they tried to sail towards the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous headwind seemed to enjoy playing tricks on the aircraft.
meanings.sent4: The headwind roared like an invisible giant trying to push the ship back.
meanings.sent5: The headwind felt like a stubborn wall blocking any progress.

meanings.definition: A difficulty or obstacle that hinders progress or success.
meanings.sent1: The team encountered a headwind in the form of budget cuts.
meanings.sent2: Overcoming the headwind of self-doubt was crucial for her success.
meanings.sent3: The headwind of procrastination kept blowing papers off his desk.
meanings.sent4: The headwind of competition felt like a fierce storm in the business world.
meanings.sent5: She fought against the headwind of negativity with a positive attitude.
